input_text:
Job Title: Cloud Based Command and Control Test SME

Location: Fort Walton Beach, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Cloud-Based Command and Control (CBC2)/USAF Weapons School Test SME

Hurlburt Field, Florida

Fort Walton Beach, Florida

HX5 is an award-winning provider of engineering, research and development, and technical services to clients such as NASA and the Department of Defense. Founded in 2004, HX5 is a fast-growing veteran- and woman-owned company with locations nationwide.

HX5 is seeking a Cloud Based Command and Control Test SME to join our team at Hurlburt Field in support of the 605th Test and Evaluation Squadron.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: 

 Advise and assist by supporting the development and implementation of T&E projects for C4ISR weapons system.  Advise and assist by interfacing with warfighter expertise across the  Theater Air Control System (TACS), and other C4ISR Systems as tasked such as:  Air Battle Management System (ABMS), Battle Control System-Fixed (BCS-F) and Tactical Operations Center Light (TOC-L).  T&E activities include, but are not limited to: test concept, design, and methodology development; test planning; test instrumentation; test execution and data collection; test data reduction and analysis; assist in the development of test reports and test briefings.  Advise and assist by supporting C4ISR system T&E (including force development evaluation (FDE), operational utility evaluation (OUE), operational assessments ( OA), tactics development and evaluation (TD&E) activities, Advanced Concept Technology  Demonstrations (ACTDs), middle tier acquisitions (MTA), rapid prototyping, agile software upgrades including sprints, concept demonstrations, operational demonstrations, and special projects conducted and supported by the 605 TES.  Support shall focus on, but not be limited to, test and evaluation of the following: C4ISR architectures, such as BCS-F open-systems architecture for automating Homeland Defense Air Operations; distributing, and processing ISR information, such as the Distributed Common Ground System (DCGS); DoD cryptographic modernization; and others that support a multitude of operational missions across the DoD; Air Force Logistics systems that support the readiness and sustainment of Aircraft and Munitions.  Assisting in the development of operational test support requests (OTSR’s), developing end of day SITREPs, after action reports (AAR), and lessons learned as required by 605 TES leadership.  May be tasked to assist in development of memorandums of agreement (MOA) and memorandum of understanding (MOU).  The lead shall submit visit authorization (VAR) and gatekeeper requests as required for TDY.  Advise and assist by providing acquisition and process support by reviewing any 605 TES acquisition support activities and products.  Assisting in the development and updates of the following: Integrated test team (ITT) charters, initial capabilities documents (ICD); capabilities development documents (CDD); capabilities production documents (CPD); operational requirements documents (ORD); analysis of alternatives (AoA); program management directives (PMD); test and evaluation strategies (TES); test and evaluation master plans (TEMP); concepts of employment (CONEMP) and concept of operations (CONOPS) and operational manuals and handbooks. 
 Experience and Other Requirements: 

 Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Tactical C2 SME. Most recent experience should be in the last 5 years. .  Must have 5 years’ experience with weapons, command and control, surveillance, identification systems 

 Preferences  :

 Preferred USAF Weapons school graduate .  Desired experience with Air Defense Sectors, ABMS, BCS-F and TOC-L.  Desired experience with agile practices and modern cloud-based software development.  Desired 3 years of experience as an operational tester.  Desired to have completed DAWIA OT&E Practitioner Certification . 

 Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: 

 This is a full-time position requiring 40 hours per week and offers a flexible work schedule Monday through Friday during core business hours. 

 Other Position Requirements: 

 Proof of U.S. Citizenship is a requirement for this position.  Must be able to complete a U.S. government background investigation.  Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance prior to date of hire.  Must have the ability to obtain a US Top Secret/SCI SSBI within one (1) year of hire.  Must be willing to travel up to 60 days per year.  Work requires sporadic physical activity.  There will be some walking, standing, bending, and carrying of radios and tactical equipment (weighing up to 35lbs and/or require 2-man lift). 

HX5 offers a competitive salary and benefits package to include:

 Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance  401(k) plan with Company Match  Paid Holidays  Paid Time Off  Parental Leave  Life Insurance  Tuition Reimbursement  Identity Protection  Medical and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts  Commuter/Transit Spending Accounts  Group Legal Coverage Options  Pet Insurance

HX5, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

HX5, LLC is a Drug Free Workplace Employer.

ACCESSIBILITY NOTICE:

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process due to a physical or mental disability, please call (850) 362-6551.

CJ

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Support C4ISR system T&E activities such as FDE, OUE, OA, TD&E, ACTDs, MTA, rapid prototyping, agile software upgrades, concept demonstrations, operational demonstrations, and special projects.
Assist in the development of OTSRs, SITREPs, AARs, and lessons learned.

Provide acquisition and process support by reviewing 605 TES activities and products.
